explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 37.8degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2003) which is classified into Category 3. The list of the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods does not contain "tetramethyl lead"; it only refers to "UN#1649 (Motor Fuel Anti-Knock Mixture)," the classes of which are all "toxic substances." A special provision, however, set forth that "substances with a flash point of less than 60degC should be labeled as "flammable liquid."

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 254degC (ICSC, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available. The list of the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods does not contain "tetramethyl lead"; it only refers to "UN#1649 (Motor Fuel Anti-Knock Mixture)," the classes of which are all "toxic substances." A special provision set forth that "substances with a flash point of less than 60degC should be labeled as "flammable liquid."

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 105mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 109mg/kg (DFGOT vol.15 (2001)) and 105mg/kg (DFGOT vol.15 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 406ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 8.87ppm (1 hour) (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (34,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 26mmHg (20degC) (equivalent to 3,500Pa at 20degC) (HSDB (2005)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: No data available. Refer to other data on lead and its compounds (primarily organic lead)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: No data available Refer to other data on lead and its compounds (primarily organic lead)

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Refer to other data on lead and its compounds (primarily organic lead) Skin sensitizer: No data available Refer to other data on lead and its compounds (primarily organic lead)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC (2004).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Insufficient data available (no data available on reproductive effects)

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "anorexia, nausea, vomiting, insomnia, tremor, debility, headache, aggression, melancholy, irritation, excitement, confusion, hallucination, acute psychosis (a few hours or a few days after the exposure), spasm, distraction, elevated temperature, coma" (DFGOT vol.15 (2001)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "hallucination, tremor, distraction, insomnia, delusion, headache, manic depression" (EHC 3 (1977)), and the evidence from animal studies including "tremor, chorea, excitement, an increase in mobility, histopathological changes in the central nervous system and liver" (DFGOT vol.15 (2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.11mg/L(Lead Tetramethyl Equivalent: 0.14mg/L) of the crustacea (Brown Shrimp) (EHC85, 1989).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and it was a metallic compound, and since an underwater action and bio-accumulation were unknown, it was classified into Category 1.
